meanings.definition: To send or deliver (goods) to a different destination.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reconsign the package to a new address.
meanings.sent2: The company is reconsigning the shipment to a warehouse closer to the customer.
meanings.sent3: By reconsigning the parcel, she avoided the long wait for delivery.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reconsigning the goods sparked a more efficient distribution plan.
meanings.sent5: Reconsigning the items made the process smoother and faster.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer (something) to a new recipient or destination.
meanings.sent1: He will reconsign the responsibility to someone else.
meanings.sent2: The manager is reconsigning the project to a different team.
meanings.sent3: Reconsigning the task brought a fresh perspective to the project.
meanings.sent4: The decision to reconsign the ownership of the property surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: She is reconsigning the authority to make the process more efficient.
